alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 04 at 10:02AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL THROUGH SATURDAY WILL CAUSE RISING STAGES ALONG THE YAKIMA RIVER... An Atmospheric River will produce moderate to heavy precipitation across the east slopes of the Washington Cascades through early Saturday morning. Total liquid precipitation amounts through 11pm PDT tonight ranging from 0.5 to 1.25 inches are expected along the foothills. Total amounts ranging from 1.50 to 3.5 inches are expected in the mountains with locally heavy amounts nearing 4 inches. This will lead to rises on rivers, with the Yakima at Easton expected to crest at action stage around 50.5-51.0 feet. This will cause areas of minor flooding to be possible along the already saturated region. Please monitor the latest river forecasts from the National Weather Service for additional information.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
